sentences: Meillä oli hauska kesä viime vuonna.
context: The Finnish word 'kesä' means summer or summertime. It is a common noun referring to the warmest season of the year between spring and autumn. In Finnish, seasons are typically used without articles like 'the', so you would say 'kesä on lämmin vuodenaika' (summer is a warm time of year) rather than 'the summer'. The word can be declined in various forms: kesässä (in/at summer), kesään (to/toward summer), kesältä (from summer), etc.
